thread.title: Colorado Avalanche unveil new 3rd jerseys during open practice
thread.title_full: Colorado Avalanche unveil new 3rd jerseys during open practice | Examiner.com

author: Andrew Demo
title: Colorado Avalanche unveil new 3rd jerseys during open practice
text:
Nick Holden, Nathan MacKinnon and Gabriel Landeskog model the new third jersey of the Colorado Avalanche before practice on Oct. 9, 2015. Colorado Avalanche/Twitter Not satisfied to simply add their Stadium Series sweater to their arsenal of jerseys, the Colorado Avalanche unveiled another new look on Friday; when they wore their new third jerseys for the first time during an open practice at the Pepsi Center.
Following in the trend set forth by the replacing of the yeti feet with their own take on the Colorado “C” on the shoulders of their primary home and away jerseys, as well as the overall design of their Stadium Series sweater; this jersey will pay homage to the Avs’ home state of Colorado.
This jersey’s primary color will be dark blue. It will feature white shoulders, red forearms and the Colorado “C” in the middle of a mountain in the center. On the left shoulder will be the Colorado flag. The jersey will also feature laces on the neck.
The third jersey was designed in a collaboration between the Avalanche (including Kroenke Sports Enterprises Creative Imaging), the NHL and Reebok. It will be worn on 14 occasions during the 2015-2016 season, with the first set to come on Oct. 24 against the Columbus Blue Jackets (view the full schedule here ). The jerseys are currently available to purchase, and can be found by clicking here .
